title: How to Make Perfectly Smooth Gravy Every Time

text: Assemble all the ingredients in one place near the stove-top.  Melt 1/4 pound of butter. Just melt it--do not cook it. Remove melted butter from the heat.  Combine white flour and melted butter over heat stirring until smooth and increase the flour until the consistency is a like soft serve ice cream. This sauce is called the roux and it is the basis for thickening. Continue stirring until flour begins to brown slightly.  Stir in very hot water until the desired consistency is achieved. The water you used to cook the potatoes works well for this. Add drippings from the turkey, salt, pepper and spices to taste.  Serve perfectly smooth, lump-free gravy piping hot.  When someone asks how you did it, just tell them to strain the lumps out with cheesecloth.  Finished.
